title: Painting Palettes Generator
text: “greatest value picture forces us notice never expected see.” - John Tukey Color one important attributes figure. Dedicated choice color can help us deliver idea vividly. goal paintingr provide set palettes paintings. Structure package based coding wesanderson packages.

title: Painting Palettes Generator
text: can install paintingr : development version GitHub :

title: Painting Palettes Generator
text: Use type="continuous" automatically interpolate colors want colors palette can offer (n > 5/6).
code: library(ggplot2) # Dummy data x <- LETTERS[1:20] y <- paste0("var", seq(1,20)) data <- expand.grid(X=x, Y=y) data$Z <- seq(1,20)+runif(400, 0, 5)  # Heatmap  pal <- paint_palette("Sunset", n=100, type="continuous") ggplot(data, aes(X, Y, fill= Z)) +    geom_tile() +    scale_fill_gradientn(colours = pal) +    scale_x_discrete(expand = c(0, 0)) +   scale_y_discrete(expand = c(0, 0)) +    coord_equal() # Heatmap with palette of "Starrynight"  ggplot(data, aes(X, Y, fill= Z)) +    geom_tile() +    scale_fill_gradientn(colours = paint_palette("Starrynight", n=100, type="continuous")) +    scale_x_discrete(expand = c(0, 0)) +   scale_y_discrete(expand = c(0, 0)) +    coord_equal() # Heatmap with palette of "Vesuvius"  ggplot(data, aes(X, Y, fill= Z)) +    geom_tile() +    scale_fill_gradientn(colours = paint_palette("Vesuvius", n=100, type="continuous")) +    scale_x_discrete(expand = c(0, 0)) +   scale_y_discrete(expand = c(0, 0)) +    coord_equal()

title: Painting Palettes Generator
code: # use iris data from `ggplot2` for demonstration data(iris)  ggplot(iris, aes(Species, Sepal.Length)) +   geom_boxplot(aes(fill = Species)) +   theme_classic() +   theme(legend.position = "top") +   scale_fill_manual(values = paint_palette("Pearlgirl"))

title: Painting Palettes Generator
code: # Scatter ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width)) +   geom_point(aes(color = Species)) +   theme_classic() +   theme(legend.position = "top") +   scale_color_manual(values = paint_palette("Caront"))

title: Painting Palettes Generator
code: data(mpg) # violin plot with 7 colors, Spring palette only have six colors add one more ggplot(mpg, aes(x=class, y=hwy, fill=class)) +    geom_violin() +   theme_classic() +   scale_fill_manual(values = c(paint_palette("Twilight", type = "continuous", n=7)))

title: Painting Palettes Generator
code: ggplot(mpg, aes(x = class, fill = drv)) +    geom_bar() +   theme_classic() +   scale_fill_manual(values = paint_palette("Seascape"))

title: Display All Available Palettes — display_all_palettes
text: n Number palettes display. palettes displayed default

title: Display All Available Palettes — display_all_palettes
text: return value, called displaying available palettes.

title: Paintings Palette Generator — paint_palette
text: name Name desired palette. Choice : Pearlgirl, Splash, Autumn, Villeneuve, Ophelia, Kitchen, Spring, Strawberries, Seascape, Twilight, Abstract, Vesuvius, Montfoort n Number colors want. type Use "discrete" "continuous". Use "continuous" automatically interpolate colors want colors.

title: Paintings Palette Generator — paint_palette
code: paint_palette("Ophelia")  paint_palette("Ophelia", n=3)  paint_palette("Autumn", n=100, type="continuous")

title: Complete List of Palettes — painting_palettes
text: Use paint_palette construct palettes desired length.
